instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 16 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cutting off,  GPU panic error
threads.message:
Hi everyone, 
I get this MacBook with rebooting issues on the loading bar, it sometimes boots to the system, once boot up I've tried GPU testing software and it was crashing straight away after turning it on. 
Checked the Log and getting :GPU-Panic: mux-regs 10 3 7f 1f 0 0 
Does anyone faced this issue before, I've tried reflow GPU and the machine started working for a few days and fail again,  I was able to do a GPU stress test, not sure now if this is a back issue from 2011 MacBook pro 15 with AMD GPU chip failure or rebelling will resolve the issue. 
I also reball GMUX (<CHIP>U9850</CHIP>) chip but this didn't help.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 16 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cutting off,  GPU panic error
threads.message:
If GPU revived few days after heat, then is the culprit for sure.
It has internal problem, like other AMD and Nvidia GPUs.

Reballing is not definitive solution.
Repetitive heat applied in the reballing process can make it last more time only.
